The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: A Value-Added, Quality School
missionstatement_desc: Build Character, Develop Leaders of Tomorrow (who will) Serve with Conviction
philosophy_culture_ethos: Bedok South Secondary School's motto is Success through Endeavour. We are a value-added, quality school that is committed to engaging and nurturing the whole child through student-centric approaches. The school strives to develop all BDSians to become active members of the society imbued with 21st century competencies and skills. We believe in inculcating the ICARE values (Integrity, Courage, Accountability, Respect,Excellence and Care) in our students to prepare them for life. The value of caring for themselves, their families, friends and the community is a very important part of BDS education and culture.
special_sdp_offered: The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects. ALP Project S.H.I.N.E. aims to bring about active student learning through the progressive development of 21st CC and skills such as critical thinking, creativity, innovation and collaborating learning. It is an interdisciplinary(Sci, EL, FCE & D&T) programme. The curriculum design involves the use of experiential and inquiry learning through the Design Thinking approach. The integration with subjects such as Science, English, FCE and Design and Technology allows students to see the relevance of what they are learning and apply them in the Design Challenge given. This curriculum is further enhanced with partnerships with tertiary institutions and enhanced elective modules to allow students to be aware of possible career opportunities. LLP Shape@BDS aims to develop students into healthy and physically educated enthusiasts for life through Sports and Outdoor Education. Students are nurtured through structured programme from Sec 1 to Sec 5. Each level takes on a thematic Sports for life programme: Sec 1 - Swimmers for Life, Sec 2 - Outdoors for Life, Sec 3 - Active Movers for Life and Sec 4/5 - Fitness Enthusiasts for Life.

visionstatement_desc: To be a vibrant community of learners that values every individual and nurtures the spirit of excellence
missionstatement_desc: To develop in every Clementeen the passion to learn, the confidence to lead, and the humility to serve
philosophy_culture_ethos: In our CTSS journey towards excellence, we believe that every Clementeen can aspire and grow in character, citizenship and academic ability. We constantly strive to imbue the ABC (ACTIVE, BRIGHT and CARING) traits in all Clementeens. We partner parents and the community to inculcate the core values of the school, 'Adaptability, Self-Discipline, Perseverance, Integrity and Respect' (ASPIRE) in every Clementeen. In the development of our staff, we focus on building Professional Learning Communities within the school to promote innovation and collegiality among staff. We believe that teachers hold the key to unlock the hearts and minds of our students, while leaders are the catalysts of change. The school thus strives for a high standard of professionalism, hones professional practice and enhances staff engagement to help our staff stay connected to our shared purpose.
special_sdp_offered: CTSS places a strong emphasis on character education and firmly believes in providing a holistic education to every student. With our strong foundation in Uniformed Groups (UGs), CTSS seeks to achieve the vision 'Every Cadet, A Leader' through our Learning for Life Programme (LLP), which develops leadership qualities in Clementeens through a structured UG experience. Acclaimed character development programmes such as 7 Habits for Highly Effective Youths (featured in Stephen Covey's book 'The Leader in Me'), Normal Technical REAL (Reflective, Experiential, Authentic and Leadership) Curriculum, Student Leadership and National Education Programmes and Service-Learning nurture 21st Century Competencies and resilience in our students. The school's Teaching and Learning framework guides teachers in the design, delivery and development of our teaching practices which would shape our students' learning experiences. The emphasis on Rigour, Relevance and Relationship guide a segmentised approach to deliver the core curriculum to all, give support to weaker students, and develop those with unique talents. Special programmes, such as Drama-in-Curriculum, Science and Maths Talent Development Programes and LOTM (Learning on the Move) using technology, are put in place to foster authentic experiential learning.  The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP), C.O.D.E. (Computing to Discover and Empower), helps our students thrive in the digital age by equipping them with computational thinking and programming skills.  The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: A school known for nurturing leaders of character and intellect.
missionstatement_desc: To provide a nurturing, challenging and inclusive environment for every Temasekian to be developed into a caring leader with exemplary character and academic excellence, and a socially responsible youth with global awareness.
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Temasek Secondary School, we are firmly guided by our Motto, "We Care". It underpins our teachers' belief and directs their approach in caring for and knowing each individual Temasekian well so that the students can be developed to the best of their abilities. In caring for our students, we ensure that they receive an education that empowers them to master their own learning and excel academically. More fundamentally, we care to systematically provide for the development of Temasekians' moral character and vital life-skills such as critical thinking, problem-solving, communication and leadership skills that enable them to adapt flexibly and rise to challenges in the future. We also design and implement with care, purposeful and engaging experiences for students to learn about various cultural, social and global issues, while guiding them to empathise with others, so that they will act on what is good and right for the family, school, community and nation.
special_sdp_offered: With our school's Student Development Vision of "Every Temasekian, A Caring Leader", all students undergo a journey of growth in personal mastery and leadership through a structured 4-year leadership course. This course empowers them with the know-how to care for, take charge and succeed in their academic pursuits and character development. Students who demonstrate potential and interest, are further developed to lead in various school-level and community-based activities as CCA leaders and/or leaders in one of the five student leadership groups. These experiences allow them to apply their leadership skills and life-skills as well as develop empathy and care for others. Students with strong academic and leadership inclinations can also participate in the 4-year Talent Development@Temasek programme. Recognising that our students need to be ready to navigate and thrive in a culturally-diverse 21st century workplace and world, all Temasekians are developed in Cross-Cultural Awareness (C2A) through a specially designed and integrated school-based curriculum. Students are first introduced to C2A in Secondary 1 via Project Culture which piques their curiosity to learn about various components of culture. Through the Secondary 2 Camp Culture as well as a range of other academic and co-curriculum platforms, students also progressively learn to observe, appreciate and interpret different cultural practices and behaviours. These learning culminate in experiential opportunities such as overseas learning trips, collaborations with local international schools and work attachments where students apply their knowledge and skills to work with people from other cultures. The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: Every Mayflowerian has a zest for life, a curious mind and a generous spirit
missionstatement_desc: Every Mayflowerian - Mighty in Thought and Deed
philosophy_culture_ethos: Mayflower Secondary School believes that every student that comes to us is a child with a unique blend of gifts and strengths. The Mayflower Promise enshrines what the school, through its programmes, activities and culture, seeks to develop in every student a zest for life, a curious mind and a generous spirit. In the quest for a life of purpose and service, Mayflowerians are constantly encouraged to be mighty in thought and deed, and to overcome their self-imposed limitations to expand their capacity. Through innovative customised programmes, the staff seeks to provide learning experiences that develop knowledge, skills and values that enable Mayflowerians to thrive in the future.
special_sdp_offered: Zest for Life: Every aspect of the Mayflower experience is designed to help students develop a strong sense of purpose and a deep love for learning, to attain their personal bests.  Being a school that offers Learning for Life Programme (LLP) in Aesthetics, students enjoy a rich performing arts experience.  The Applied Learning Programme (ALP) in Effective Communication helps our students grow in confidence as bilingual communicators, able to adapt their message to purpose, audience and context.  Curious Mind: We want our students to be discerning learners who are well-equipped for life. Besides academic rigour, students develop 21st Century competencies and life skills through customised programmes such as exciting overseas immersion programmes in Hong Kong and Indonesia. Through the Mayflower Youth Environmental Guardian (YEG) programme, students apply what they have learnt about the environment in authentic contexts, contributing meaningfully to environmental protection.  Generous Spirit: Character is shaped through rigorous academic and CCA experiences where values such as integrity and commitment are emphasised. We promote a positive peer culture where excellence is attained through mutual help and encouragement.  In CCA, our students learn the importance of giving of their best and take joy in celebrating one another's success.  In VIA, students contribute by serving their peers and in helping local and overseas communities.  The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

mrt_desc: BEDOK MRT, EUNOS MRT, KAKI BUKIT MRT
visionstatement_desc: Leaders for the Future; Creative Lifelong Learners, Morally Upright, Caring and Loyal
missionstatement_desc: To develop our students holistically through quality programmes within a nurturing environment.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our School Philosophy is 'All can Learn, All can Achieve, All can Serve' which describes our belief for life-long learning and learning for life; our attitude to strive for excellence in whatever we do as well as our caring heart and responsibility to give back to the society. We seek to inculcate in our students the six school values: Resilience, Respect, Responsibility, Integrity, Care and Harmony to achieve the five BNSS desired outcomes of 'Strive for Excellence; Encourage Experimentation; Rejoice in Doing Good; Value Diversity; Embrace Lifelong Learning' (SERVE) in our students. Over the years, our students have achieved value-added outcomes in both academic and non-academic domains. All these are attributed to a team of dedicated teachers, committed non-teaching staff as well as our supportive parents.
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP) in Environmental Studies and Sustainable Living aims to enhance students' awareness and understanding of environmental issues and knowledge of sustainable living. In the water sensing module, students learn about programming using Arduino and making use of sensors to measure water quality. In the clean energy module, they design prototypes that harness solar energy to power solar cars. Students are also given opportunities to understand how other country creates a sustainable environment through the ALP Overseas Trip. They are thus better equipped to understand concepts relating to environmental science, and local and global environmental issues. Students are also equipped with ICT and research skills to complete their projects and coursework. The Learning for Life Programme (LLP) provides opportunities for students to develop an appreciation for the arts and maximize their potential in their different areas of talents. Through the learning and training processes in the arts, students develop good character and 21st century competencies. These learning experiences in Arts Education not only deepen students' awareness and interest in the various aesthetics areas, but also teach them ways to transfer their learning to serve the community. In line with the school's vision of preparing students to be leaders for the future, the school develops in students self-awareness for personal leadership and effectiveness. Workshops and Leadership camps are organised for student leaders (class leaders, CCA leaders and Student Councillors) to enable them to lead with competence and confidence. The school provides opportunities for students to participate in sports; and mounts life-skills programmes (such as the Biennial Fiesta and Musical, Motivational and Study Skills Workshops, subject-based learning journeys, VIA, overseas cultural exchanges and Cohort Overseas Trip) for the holistic development of students.

visionstatement_desc: Bringing out the Best in Every Individual
missionstatement_desc: Providing a well-rounded education within a challenging, caring and supportive environment.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Tampines Secondary School aims to develop every Tampinesian into a self-directed and motivated learner who embodies the school values of Teamwork, Perseverance, Service and Success. In an environment of care and excellence, students are equipped with the skills and competencies required to thrive in the future. Towards this endeavour, the school offers customised cohort anchor programmes such as Modern Day Science, Media Literacy, Mathepulative, and Authentic Problem Solving through Design Thinking, to ignite students' curiosity and extend their learning beyond the standard curriculum. The school's co-curriculum provides opportunities for students to develop character, acquire leadership and life skills, as well as prepares them for their next phase of learning. Quality school experiences are provided through level camps, cohort bonding activities, service learning projects, education and career guidance programmes and leadership training adapted from Ron Edmonson's 3C Leadership Model.  Beyond academic and character development, the school aims to inculcate in its students a healthy and active lifestyle.  The school promotes a sporting culture through its signature programme, SPARKs (Sports & Play for Active & Recreational Kids), which provides opportunities for students to be engaged in sports electives such as handball, tchoukball and floorball during curriculum time.  These sporting activities further reinforce collaboration skills, team spirit and commitment in all Tampinesians to strive for excellence. Through these varied and customised learning experiences, the school provides a holistic education to bring out the Best in Every Individual according to his or her interests and abilities.
special_sdp_offered: The school offers a Learning for Life Programme in 'Creative Expressions: Expressing Creatively Through Visual and Performing Arts'.  Creative Expressions aid in developing students' ability to acquire new skills; collaborate with one another; communicate effectively; be innovative and flexible; and to strive for excellence.  These competencies are nurtured through the Arts and Aesthetics Programme where students are offered various electives in the genre: drama, music and dance, based on their interest.  Apart from picking up new skills, students go through various stages of critique and peer evaluation, which reinforces empathy, communication and collaboration.  To promote applied learning in the academic domain, the school has an Applied Learning Programme in 'Creative Engineering: Inter-disciplinary Authentic Problem Solving'.  Using the Design Thinking framework, the school aims to integrate problem solving into the disciplines of Mathematics and the Sciences (Physics). The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: A Dynamic Institution That Adds Value To All
missionstatement_desc: To nurture Bukit Viewans to be creative, passionate and resilient learners who possess moral integrity and are responsible to self and society
philosophy_culture_ethos: Every student matters. BVSS focuses on providing every student with a quality and meaningful school experience through a school-based total curriculum. Students enjoy learning in a positive, enriching and stimulating environment and teachers care for, grow and nurture students into wholesome, contributing and thinking individuals. Strong teacher-student relations establish an ethos of care and provide the environment to imbue students in strong moral values so that they grow and mature into confident persons, concerned citizens and active contributors - individuals with robust character and a quest for knowledge and learning.
special_sdp_offered: BVSS leverages its niche on Environmental Science and Sustainable Living to develop the Applied Learning Programme (ALP) on 'Clean Energy and Environmental Technology'. This ALP is part of the BVSS-designed Junior OUtstanding Leaders in Energy for Sustainability (JOULES) Programme where it aims to inculcate students with the knowledge and experience in the area of environment and sustainable energy as well as emphasizing the development of environmental student leadership. All students are part of the JOULES programme where they will undergo tier 1 programme in lower secondary and selected students in tier 2 programme in their upper secondary.    As part of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) education, BVSS also focusses on developing students through the Coding and Computational Thinking Infused (CACTUS) Curriculum. This is the school's deliberate approach to integrate coding programmes into different subjects through multiple platforms. This allows students to transfer the CACTUS skills learnt to other disciplines subjects ranging from Computing, Math, Science, ALP and Citizenship and Character Education.  BVSS delivers its Learning for Life (LLP) - 'Learning the Arts, Living the Values - Character Education through Drama' via Literature and Social Studies lessons for lower secondary students.  This complements the robust school-wide and developmental CCE Programme which includes cohort and modular leadership training, life-skills training and Education Career Guidance.   Learning at BVSS is centred on providing and designing engaging experiences through authentic and meaningful learning tasks. Our 5E Curriculum Approach coupled with WRAITEC Thinking tool as well as harnessing ICT affordances provides students with an enriching and engaging learning environment.

visionstatement_desc: Weave - quality teaching, learning & values Dream - the best Lead - to inspire
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Caring, Confident and Creative individuals equipped to face life's challenges.
philosophy_culture_ethos: A School Distinction Award and Singapore Quality Class school, the school is committed to achieving its mission, 'Nurturing caring, confident and creative individuals equipped to face life's challenges'. Through the school motto 'Wisdom and Truth', the school seeks to imbue in each student the school values, represented in the acronym WISDOM, which stands for: Working with others, Integrity, PerSeverance, Dedication, LOyalty and Mindset of excellence. The school strongly believes that quality staff, and strong partnerships with alumni, parents, community and educational partners are the foundation for organisational excellence. The students' many achievements in the Academics, Sports, Performing Arts and Uniform Groups are a testament to the impact of our programmes and commitment in equipping them with the values, skills and knowledge to excel even when students may or may not have the background or prerequisites. We groom our students to be confident and ready for the ever changing economic and social landscape.
special_sdp_offered: The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.  The school runs two distinctive school programmes in the Applied Learning Programme entitled "Real Food, Real Science" and the Learning for Life Programme entitled "Active Glocal Citizens". The Real Food, Real Science Programme is customised for different courses and allows our students to apply the skills they learnt in investigative experiences in Food Science to create healthier food and/or provide services in the Food and Beverage Industry. Two signature modules in Basic Science Research and Hub Cafe@WDL nurture our students to become creative problem solvers. The Active Glocal Citizens Programme provides training in social innovation and entrepreneurship at lower secondary level with local Values-in-Action as the context for application. It culminates in Secondary 3 when our students apply the skills in the cohort overseas Values-in-Action expeditions to ASEAN countries. The programme aspires to prepare our students to be future contributors in the form of community youth leaders. Follow us on our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/woodlandssecondarysch) or our Instagram account @woodlandssec for up-to-date information on the learning experiences of our students.

mrt_desc: HOUGANG MRT, SERANGOON MRT, SENG KANG MRT
visionstatement_desc: Every Bowenian a Passionate Learner, Leader and Champion.
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Learning. Developing Character. Inspiring Service.
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Bowen Secondary School we are committed to cultivating a mind-set of life-long learning, strength of character and service to others in our students. We also aspire for Bowenians to uphold the school values of, 'Respect, Responsibility, Compassion, Resilience, Teamwork and Excellence'. There is a culture of care in Bowen where teachers not only teach but also guide every Bowenian to reach for excellence. Bowen's school motto, 'I Believe, Therefore I Am' exemplifies our belief that our students will fulfil their aspirations when they believe in their own abilities and are determined to strive for excellence.
special_sdp_offered: Students benefit from the school's holistic education which is designed to provide a rigorous and engaging academic curriculum as well as develop students' character through the various CCAs and the Service Learning programme. Bowen challenges students to do well academically, while providing opportunities for them to be fully engaged in learning through creative programmes such as LifeLit, a drama-infused language arts programme for Lower Secondary students. The school's strong CCA culture provides a well-balanced and comprehensive co-curricular programme that helps the students to grow into well-rounded individuals. Under the school's Community Youth Leaders (CYL) programme, community service is offered as a platform for students to inspire, and be inspired, by engaging in service to others. The school was accorded the Community Youth Leadership pilot school status by the National Youth Council, as well as the Learning for Life Programme (LLP) status by MOE in 2014. The school's Social Entrepreneurship Programme (SEP) seeks to nurture creativity, encourage a spirit of enterprise and build empathy, thus preparing students to be entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs in the future. The SEP teaches students to use the tools of Design Thinking to approach challenges and opportunities to create suitable solutions. The school was accorded the Applied Learning Programme (ALP) status in 2016. The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: A premier school which provides quality holistic education to every BBSSian.
missionstatement_desc: To nurture BBSSians to be self-directed learners with abundance mentality.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We believe every child is unique and has innate abilities to be developed.  Our school values - RESPECT (Reflection, Enterprise, Self-discipline, Perseverance, Empathy, Creativity, Teamwork), mission and vision, represent our collective passion, dreams and aspirations, and guide us in how we work with our parents, community and partners to realise the full potential of our students.  We endeavour to build a culture of care, self-directedness and compassion amongst staff and students.  At BBSS, children are firmly at the heart of our work and we seek to develop the whole child by providing meaningful and connected learning experiences that will allow every BBSSian to develop the right values, competencies and skills to do well in the 21st century.
special_sdp_offered: As our foundational programme, we adopted Arthur L. Costa's the Habits of Mind (HOM) to inculcate in BBSSians good learning habits and thinking dispositions so that they can become self-directed, life-long learners.  BBSSians systematically learn the 16 habits through hands-on experiences and then practise these habits daily.  Our LLP is the Community Youth Leadership Programme which aims to nurture RESPECTful Leaders who are confident and self-directed in serving the community with abundance mentality. This programme encompasses the twin pillars of Leadership Development and Values-In-Action (VIA) and provides BBSSians with leadership training experiences like Outward Bound courses and overseas expeditions and opportunities to organise school-wide events like Project Mi and Project Heartwork.  Our ALP is in the area of embedded electronics.  It builds upon the fundamentals of Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) and aims to develop BBSSians as proactive problem-solvers who care for the world.  This programme focuses on application of sensing technologies in our everyday life.

visionstatement_desc: A School of Distinction. A Community of Leaders.  School motto : We Will Excel.   School Values : Integrity we uphold Respect we show Gratitude we express   Resilience we develop
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Confident Leaders, Active Citizens and Global Thinkers - YTzens for the Future
philosophy_culture_ethos: YTSS is guided by its vision, 'A School of Distinction, A Community of Leaders', and is committed to developing every YTzen to be a Confident Leader, Active Citizen and a Global Thinker. It holds firmly to the belief that every student can and wants to learn, and this translates into a commitment to unlock the potential of every child. The school also places a strong emphasis on cultivating self-discipline and imbuing the core values of Integrity, Respect, Resilience and Gratitude in our students. This student-centric approach in educating our students can also be seen in our curriculum. It is designed and implemented by our caring and professional team of teachers who embrace the core belief of 'leave no child behind'. The curriculum is crafted with the learners in mind and seeks to deepen our students' understanding of the various disciplines, making learning engaging and meaningful for them. Working closely with supportive parents and alumni, as well as the community and other partners in education, there is a strong community of support in YTSS to create a nurturing environment and provide the best learning experience for all YTzens. The school motto, 'We will Excel' is the guiding beacon for all YTzens and it permeates the school culture. The various awards and accolades the school is accorded and has achieved are testimonies of our steadfast commitment to excellence.
special_sdp_offered: Students participate in programmes aligned to the YTzen profile that are designed for their holistic development. These programmes teach character education while challenging our students cognitively and physically. Confident Leader: All students participate in the NYAA (Silver) Programme, learning different skill sets and nurturing attributes that ensure holistic development. They also undergo leadership training through the Student Leadership Development Programmes that involve level camps, expeditions and service learning projects. Selected Student Leaders have the opportunities to take part in the Aspiring and Empowering Leaders Programmes to further develop their leadership competencies. NT students develop life skills and vocational skills in the MY LIFE Programme. Active Citizens: Social-emotional competencies are taught through Process Drama and Values@Heart lessons. Classes also plan and carry out Service Learning projects and reflect on our nation's history as they participate in Heritage Trails designed by our teachers. Global Thinkers: The YTSS Cross-Cultural Learning Programmes expand our students' global outlook while developing their intercultural competencies through local and overseas exchange programmes and learning journey. The STAR Programmes also challenges our students cognitively through interesting research projects in collaboration with Institutes of Higher Learning, both local and overseas.

visionstatement_desc: Grateful Children. Respectful Pupils. Compassionate Citizens
missionstatement_desc: Care. Lead. Inspire. Partner
philosophy_culture_ethos: Founded in 2001, Hougang Secondary School (HS) provides an all-round education for Hougeans to pursue their strengths and passions. As a school of distinction, HS is recognised for having best practices in Student All-Round Development, Character and Citizenship Education (CCE), and Teaching & Learning. With a strong belief that "Every Student Counts", HS places strong emphasis on character and values education. The school is committed to nurture every Hougean into a Grateful Child, Respectful Pupil and Compassionate Citizen (GRC) who will make the difference in their life journey even after they have left the gates of HS. There are opportunities for our students to be imbued with GRC values through values-driven CCAs that cater to the different needs and interests of the students. Gratitude - HS teaches every Hougean to show acts of appreciation as their successes are the joint effort of their parents, teachers and the community. Respect - HS teaches every Hougean the value of respecting themselves and others. Compassion - HS teaches every Hougean to serve the real needs of the community through regular weekly service. More than 80% of our Hougeans are Service Leaders.
special_sdp_offered: HS has a strong conviction in character excellence as the school believes that strong values will provide students the impetus towards academic excellence. Therefore, the school's Learning for Life Programme - Community Youth Leadership programme, "GRC in Action, A Hougean Way of Life", provides a sustained and enhanced values education progressively over 4/5 years. Leveraging the 3Es approach to VIA (Enrich Minds, Encourage Hearts, Engage Hands), students take ownership of their involvement by understanding the needs of the community, co-constructing with and mentoring their peers to bring about awareness, action and advocacy in a community need. One signature event is the Secondary 3 Overseas Service Learning where students plan and serve in countries in the region. In order to nurture our Hougeans to be confident speakers, the school has embarked on an exciting journey in our Applied Learning Programme, "English Communication Skills through Authentic Learning" to promote communication skills using real life learning platforms. By furnishing our students with authentic settings and problems, they will be able to acquire useful and portable communication skills. The programme includes broadcasting, public speaking, debates, drama and journalism. HS provides a robust Teaching & Learning curriculum that focuses on experiential learning. Programmes include ICT-based multimedia project work: blogs, audio and video podcasts, learning journeys, learning experiences through critical reading, creative writing and strategic oral communication workshops, Sec 1 Math Trail, Sec 2 Maths Magic, HS Math Talent Programme, ELEMENTZ Science Research Conference and Exhibition, Funtasia (Science Fun Day), IHL Outreach Programme to University and Polytechnics, Humanities Inquiry Learning (Social Studies, Elective Geography/History), Earth Week, Life Run Carnival, Sec 2 Adventure Camp, Sports Education Programme, Inter-class Games, Interdisciplinary Project Work and SciTechHuMatics.

visionstatement_desc: A school of excellence that nurtures world-ready Bicultural Scholars who embrace tradition and are champions of society.
missionstatement_desc: To nurture confident, creative and cultured students with a passion for learning.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Nan Hua High School is founded on the Confucian values Li Yi Lian Chi Zhong Xiao Ren Ai. We take pride in our school heritage and believe in providing a student-centric, values-driven holistic education anchored on the four tenets of school culture -'Ren',Excellence,Learning and Collegiality. Our learning environment nurtures each child's talents and interests especially through our niche programmes, namely the SAP (Special Assistance Plan) & Biculture Programme, Performing Arts, and Environment Education. Our values education emphasises the development of each Nanhuarian as "junzi" or scholar in the Confucian context.
special_sdp_offered: The school's SAP and Biculture Programme emphasises the inculcation of school values and culture. In line with our school vision of developing bicultural scholars, our Biculture Programme nurtures our students to have bicultural perspectives; to understand the western and eastern ways of thinking and distil the best of both. In the curriculum, Secondary 1 students learn to appreciate Chinese culture and traditions. Translation and Interpretation as well as learning about Contemporary China enable Secondary 2 and 3 students to learn techniques of translation and the issues and trends in modern China respectively. The Biculture Week activities, Confucian Camp and celebration of the Mid-Autumn Festival are examples of opportunities for students to learn and live out values beyond the classroom. Our Character Education Programme is centred on the eight Confucian values of providing the focus for students to learn and understand Confucian values in the context of ancient times and its application to the 21st century world. These values are taught through narratives and stories allowing students to discuss and internalise the values. To complement what is taught in the classroom, the Values Portal is prepared specially for parents to engage their child in further conversations at home. Other activities include Camp Achiever, a school-wide camp, and the Ceremonial Walk through the Values Gateway, which serves to enable students to imbibe school values and symbolises Nanhuarians embracing the school values respectively. CnME is a school-developed curriculum where our students develop 21st century competencies as they explore areas of interest. Anchored in the guiding principle POTENTIAL (Providing Opportunities To Engage and Nurture Talent In Academic areas of Learning), the curriculum has elements of collaborative work, research and ICT skills and a focus on creativity.

visionstatement_desc: Learn, Care and Make a Difference
missionstatement_desc: To nurture Confident and Passionate Hillgrovians who continually Learn with a spirit to do one's best, Care for and Serve others to Make a Difference.
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school's philosophy is 'Potential + Character = Success'. It means that the school believes in each student and builds his/her character in order to help him/her to succeed. Staff and students are also guided by the school values of Integrity, Care, Responsibility, Respect and Resilience.
special_sdp_offered: Hillgrove's Flight & Aerospace (F&A) ALP aims to raise students' understanding of and appreciation for Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) in the field of aerospace. Through our programme design and strong partnerships with the aerospace industry, we aspire to do our part in nurturing future aerospace professionals in support of Singapore's goal to be Asia's Aviation Hub.  Our F&A ALP is a four-year programme which builds real-life knowledge and skills and raises awareness of the different types of careers within the aerospace industry. Adding to the rigor in the Academics, CCA programmes and F&A ALP, we also have our Arts LLP for the holistic development of Hillgrovians. Through the Arts LLP, students will be able to articulate and communicate their ideas and talents effectively. As a school, we also want to ignite the students' interest and passion towards the Arts and for them to consider careers in the Arts.

visionstatement_desc: Loyang Secondary School is a happy and caring school where students achieve their potential, are of robust character and are well prepared for the skilforce of tomorrow.
missionstatement_desc: To build a team of competent and dedicated staff, working closely with our stakeholders in delivering rigorous and comprehensive academic and character development programmes that bring out the best in every student.
philosophy_culture_ethos: At Loyang Secondary School (LYSS), every child is unique and important. We do everything with love, constantly and purposefully doing whatever it takes to pursue quality service, thus impacting the lives of students in our care with passion.  The school focuses on holistic student development programmes, emphasising on academic value-addedness and character development and a rewarding school experience.  From 2014, the school has initiated the Loyang Experience for all students, with the intent of strengthening student-centricity and accentuating the distinctiveness of LYSS. The Loyang Experience integrates key programmes (such as Teaching and Learning, Character and Citizenship Education and Applied Learning) through common student outcomes and is aimed at strengthening the holistic development of students.
special_sdp_offered: One signature programme in The Loyang Experience is our Applied Learning Programme (ALP), Effective Communication. The hallmark of a confident person is his/her ability to communicate effectively. LYSS has adopted a whole-school approach to the development of students' oral communication skills through promoting the use of good spoken English in daily interaction within and beyond curriculum time. In addition, we believe in creating opportunities for all students to express themselves in the classroom by using pedagogical approaches that promote oral communication as well as providing platforms beyond the classroom for students who show talent in this area. Some of these platforms include Public Speaking, Debates and Drama. With the emphasis on developing 21st Century Competencies in our students and to create an internationalisation experience for our students, all Sec 3 students will have the opportunity to participate in Overseas Education Programme. The school's Uniformed Groups and Performance Arts groups excel in the area of student development. Through a wide array of activities, students of different backgrounds have ample opportunities to interact with each other and build closer bonds. These programmes also contribute significantly to developing individuals of sound character imbued with the school values of Integrity, Resilience, Respect, and Compassion. Other Programmes Offered Include: Elective and Advanced Elective Modules, Conversational Chinese and Malay, Educational and Career Guidance Programme, National Youth Achievement Award Programme, Overseas Education Programme, Public Speaking Programme, Reading Programme, Sports Education Programme, Student Leadership Programme and Swimming Programme. Enrichment Activities Include: Guitar, Guzheng, Ukulele, Tchoukball and Finger Painting.

visionstatement_desc: Leading Hearts, Leading Minds
missionstatement_desc: To develop Xinmin students to their full potential, to inculcate in them sound values, as well as a mindset for excellence, and to nurture them to be responsible and caring members of society.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Xinmin strives to maintain its rich heritage and tradition of providing the very best learning environment for its students. In this school, staff and stakeholders inculcate good personal, moral, and social values in our students, as well as discipline and a focus on learning for life to shape the whole person. This is done through a range of activities and programmes. Our students excel in sports and outdoor activities, arts, service to school and community, as well as in their academic studies. The school community is strongly supported by a committed and dedicated team of alumni and the School Advisory Committee, who believe in providing a holistic and enriching school experience for our students. Facilities in the school are constantly upgraded and leading programmes are developed to stretch the cognitive, physical, aesthetics, and social-moral domains of development of our students. Student learning is also enabled through a capable team of teachers who demonstrate the highest level of professionalism and care as they design and carry out activities and programmes, both in and out of the classrooms. Our students thrive in this stimulating environment of care, discipline and excellence.
special_sdp_offered: In Xinmin, the development of 21st century skills is integrated into our curriculum and our tiered approach provides varying developmental opportunities to students according to their interests and abilities. In addition, all our students look forward to our school-based curriculum, comprising Analytical Thinking Skills, a games-based approach to learning thinking skills; Applied Science Programme which allows students to apply their Science knowledge in research and problem solving; ICT and Enterprise programmes which allow students to exercise creative and inventive thinking; Drama at Sec 2 level which allows students to express their thoughts and ideas through performance; as well as an enjoyable and challenging PE programme that allows students to develop psychomotor skills, learn new games, acquire soft skills and mindsets of resilience and teamwork. Our Flipped Classroom pedagogy at the lower secondary levels emphasises collaborative and self-directed learning, and allows students to acquire lifelong skills for future learning. Leadership training is provided to all students and student leaders are given many opportunities for further development in skills and exposure to real-world learning.

visionstatement_desc: Dynamic Thinkers. Inspiring Leaders. Contributing Citizens. One Learning Community.
missionstatement_desc: Building Character, Nurturing Talents
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Greenridge Secondary School, we believe that every child matters and everyone can "Learn, Improve and Excel".  As one learning community with a strong culture of excellence, care, collaboration and reflection, we aim to develop every Greenridgean to be a dynamic thinker, an inspiring leader and a contributing citizen. Our Greenridgeans will develop the capacity for good thinking, the ability to manage self and others well and the resolve to lead their life with a clear sense of purpose and a strong desire to contribute to the larger good of the community and nation.
special_sdp_offered: In providing quality holistic education for all Greenridgeans, Greenridge Secondary School emphasizes academic excellence and character excellence. Our key programmes include an integrated Character and Citizenship Education programme which aims to inculcate in our students moral values, tenacity, socio-emotional awareness, social and national responsibility. The school's Learning for Life Programme through Arts Education is a 3-year progressive programme that caters to all students. Through the programme, students learn about the different art forms in Music, Performing Arts, Visual Art and Drama so as to nurture their aesthetic talents and creativity. To develop communication and thinking skills, all students undergo the school's Applied Learning Programme through CLAP (Camera, Lights, and Action Programme), a 3-year Media Literacy Programme infused in the English and Chinese Language Curriculum.  Other programmes include Esprit d' Excellence, Leadership Training, Overseas Learning Journeys, Modular Science Education, Advanced Elective Modules for Express and Normal(Academic) students, Elective Modules for Normal(Academic) & Normal(Technical) students and Sports Education.  The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible (NA) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on thier PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: Lifelong Learners, Exemplary Leaders
missionstatement_desc: To nurture youth with a passion for learning, shape leaders of character and develop useful citizens through a comprehensive education
philosophy_culture_ethos: At Springfield Secondary School, we inspire our students to develop a passion for learning by offering a broad-based curriculum which caters to a wide spectrum of student abilities and interest. Through our enriching academic and character development programmes, we seek to develop our students to be leaders grounded in our school's core values of graciousness, responsibility, resilience, integrity and diligence, who will serve the school and community with pride.
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP), 'Exploring Health Sciences through SP2A' focuses on four areas of health sciences - Sports Science, Physiology, Pharmacology and Alternative Medicine. The ALP aims to develop students to be self-directed learners equipped with necessary skills and knowledge that will enable them to take on challenges of the future. During the ALP lessons, students learn to design prototypes such as heartbeat sensors which are used by healthcare and sports science professionals. Students also embark on learning journeys and attachments to health science related companies and institutions to experience and understand the challenges, needs and expectations of healthcare professionals. The school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP), 'GEARing Springfielders for Success', seeks to nurture students to be socially responsible and develop in them a spirit of volunteerism to make a difference to the community. Through the school's LLP which focuses on Community and Youth Leadership (CYL), the school designs learning experiences for students to acquire a critical set of skills and knowledge related to CYL. This is done through purposeful partnerships with the community partners to provide opportunities for students to transfer their learning and put into practice the skills learned. To equip our students with the 21st century competencies, the school conducts programmes such as the Code for Fun Programme and the Learning Festival. The Lower Secondary students undergo a 2-year Code for Fun programme to enhance their coding, logical thinking and problem solving skills. The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

visionstatement_desc: Learning School, Caring Community, Contributing Citizens
missionstatement_desc: To nurture individuals to succeed with values and purpose
philosophy_culture_ethos: The school strives to nurture students of fine character and to provide all students with a holistic education that prepares them well for the future. To prepare students for the 21st century workforce, inquiry and inventive thinking are promoted through team learning, collaboration and the use of Information Technology. While striving for excellence, students are also nurtured in a caring and safe environment where learning is fun. Students are inculcated with values such as integrity, respect and responsibility so that when they graduate, they are not only equipped with the skills and talents to lead productive lives, but are also imbued with good moral values and contribute back to society. This is what defines Bishan Park Secondary School (BPSS).
special_sdp_offered: The school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP), the Holistic ARTs (HART) Programme, provides all lower secondary students with a variety of learning experiences beyond the formal Art curriculum. A rich repertoire comprising six arts modules (ceramics, sculpture, digital art, music composition, instrument playing and dance) deepens appreciation and enhances knowledge and skills in the Arts. Students who demonstrate talent are provided platforms and opportunities to further hone their talents through the Visual Arts Talent Development Programme. The school was presented with the National Arts Education Glow Award (2013) by the National Arts Council in recognition of its holistic approach to Arts Education. The school's Applied Learning Programme (ALP), the iCAST Programme, allows students to apply English Language skills from various genres in an authentic setting. All lower secondary students go through the Media Studies Programme where they further hone their language skills as they engage in scripting, video-casting and storyboarding. Students also acquire related ICT skills progressively.  The iCast Programme not only facilitates the use of the English Language to communicate ideas and values and to educate the community, but also allows students to deepen their learning. Students are also offered a glimpse of the possible careers in the fields of media and broadcasting.

visionstatement_desc: A Community of Passionate Learners and Compassionate Leaders. As a school, we are a caring community with shared values and purpose. As passionate learners, we are self-directed, resilient and have a love of learning. As compassionate leaders, we are empathetic, humble and act with integrity.
missionstatement_desc: To nurture students holistically and develop them to be active citizens.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Character development is a top priority in Chua Chu Kang Sec School. The school believes that a sound and strong character must come first, for it lays the very foundation for success in every endeavour. The school will continue to improve its heart-ware to enable all students to imbibe and demonstrate the school values of Managing Self, Putting Others before Self, and Striving to Excel. Students are nurtured to have a passion for learning and the requisite skills to be self-directed and collaborative learners in order to realise their full potential. Students are developed into compassionate leaders to serve the school, community and nation. Through service, they grow and excel. A strong, caring and collaborative culture amongst staff and students uniquely holds the school together.
special_sdp_offered: The Applied Learning Programme (ALP), Robotics and Automation for a Better Tomorrow, aims to instill better appreciation of technologies, practical understanding and application of learning as well as 21st century competencies and interest in STEM-related careers. The Learning for Life Programme (LLP) is in the area of Community and Youth Leadership in alignment with the school vision of compassionate leaders with the underlying belief that everyone can lead and will need to lead others at different points of their lives. The LLP takes a two-pronged approach of explicit teaching and experiential learning to develop leadership qualities and skills such as initiative and developing others. The school is implementing greater flexibility in subject offering at lower secondary levels. Eligible N(A) and N(T) students can take some subjects at a higher level starting from Secondary 1, based on their PSLE results. Beyond the start of Secondary 1, students can also do so if they do well in those subjects.

second_vp_name: MR MUHAMMAD FARIZAL BIN UMAR EFFE
visionstatement_desc: Learning in Damai Today, Growing to be Leaders of Tomorrow.
missionstatement_desc: We Nurture Our Students to be Committed, Competent and Compassionate Leaders.
philosophy_culture_ethos: In Damai, we believe every child has the capacity to learn with the encouragement, motivation and guidance we give them. In addition to providing students with an academic curriculum to develop cognitive skills, knowledge and attitudes, we also focus on character and leadership development. Our LLP builds students' character, leadership and life-skills like resilience and a collaborative spirit to navigate life's challenges. The school's unique Values-in-Action (VIA) programme provides excellent opportunities to translate values and leadership skills into action and nurture concerned citizens, active contributors and confident leaders of the 21st century. The LLP-infused Waterways Clean-up is a rare opportunity to use kayaking skills to care for the environment and appreciate water as a precious resource. STEM-ALP infused VIA initiatives such as visits to NKF and old folks' homes provide yet another platform to further develop empathy as we nurture them to become compassionate leaders. We are heartened that our students have done well in both academic and character domains over the years.  With support from parents and collaboration with tertiary institutions, we will continue to ride on the waves of academic and character excellences that characterise Damai culture, vision, mission and values.
special_sdp_offered: The school has 2 distinctive programmes. To embrace the challenges of the 21st century, Damai seeks to anchor students on sound values and develop them as leaders of good character with a sense of belonging to school and nation. Our Learning for Life Programme (LLP) - Character, Citizenship and Leadership Development through Water Sports, develops students to become Committed, Competent and Compassionate Leaders with an appreciation for life-long fitness. Through a tiered experience Damaians are introduced to water sports like swimming, kayaking, dragon boating, wakeboarding and sailing. Through this they also learn to appreciate 'water' not just as a precious resource, but also understand its qualities and value. Our STEM-Applied Learning Programme (ALP) in Health Sciences and Healthcare Technology aims to provide authentic learning experiences for students to apply learning in real-world contexts, acquire complex problem solving skills and widen perspectives on healthcare and health sciences industries. The learning environment also fosters team work and open-ended tinkering to enable students to develop 21st Century Competencies and an innovative spirit. STEM-ALP also aims to create awareness and deepen learning on health-related issues, such as nutritional sciences, infectious diseases, healthcare technologies and palliative care for the disabled and elderly. Our extensive partnership with external partners exposes students to the developments in the healthcare sector and allows them to gain deeper insights into healthcare and health sciences related careers. The school will also offer Retail Operations, an Applied ITE subject, as an optional elective to S3NT students from 2017 to better meet their aspirations.

mrt_desc: ANG MO KIO MRT, BISHAN MRT
visionstatement_desc: Every Student A Thinking and Gracious Citizen
missionstatement_desc: To develop the potential of every child and to nurture him into an individual with a sense of self-worth and integrity, capable of coping with life's challenges and responsible in meeting the needs of the community.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We believe that every child can thrive in a responsive and nurturing environment to become contributing members of society. We take care of students by guiding their mind, shaping their character, and nurturing their talents. At the end of the day, we would like our students to reach their fullest potential and be the best they can be.
special_sdp_offered: The school offers the Applied Learning Programme (ALP), 'Nurturing Critical Thinkers Through the Learning of Sustainable Technology', in which students apply their learning of Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) in authentic settings. Students are taught to use the Design Thinking methodology to design, build and prototype devices which run on clean energy. Through this programme, students acquire 21st century competencies such as critical thinking and problem-solving skills that will put them in good stead in any STEM-related course of study that they wish to pursue in future. The school's Learning for Life Programme (LLP) focuses on 'Growing Socially Responsible Citizens Through the Chong Boon Student Leaders Programme'. The LLP is integrated with various curricular and co-curricular programmes to equip students with key knowledge, skills and attitudes of a leader. The leadership training is based on Sean Covey's '7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens' and focuses on the development of self and peer leadership. The Chong Boon Growth Camp is a four- or five-year Character Development Programme through which students learn important life skills such as leadership, collaboration, communication, and develop social-emotional and cross-cultural competencies. Other innovative programmes that prepare our students for the future include the Life-Science Programme which adds value to the students' classroom learning as they acquire essential biology skills practiced in research laboratories, such as extraction of DNA and growing of bacteria. The school also partners the polytechnics to offer Advanced Elective Modules to provide greater diversity in learning experiences and expose students to applied topics such as Creative Product Design that will prepare them well for further education.

visionstatement_desc: Motivated Learners, Assets to Community
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing Minds, Shaping Character, Strengthening Vigour
philosophy_culture_ethos: Northland is a vibrant school, demonstrating dynamic progress and great promise in recent years. Focusing on both academic outcomes and character development, the school is set to advance steadily forward, producing students who are both motivated learners and assets to the community. It endeavours to make every student who walks through its gates a NORTHSTAR - someone who is a guiding light to others in the community, with the attributes of a Concerned Citizen, Creative Artiste, Servant Leader, Caring Friend, Active Sportsman and Critical Thinker. The school believes in engaging all students through strong teacher-student relationships, thus cultivating a culture of care.
special_sdp_offered: The school's Applied Learning Programme aims to nurture critical thinkers & self-directed learners in health sciences & healthcare technology. Through project work, students monitor their health in novel ways, gather data to analyse, propose and present plans to improve their well-being. Students conduct research and design ways to aid the elderly so that they are empowered to live more fulfilling lives. 'Game for Life', the school's Learning for Life Programme, leverages sports and physical activities to empower students with passion, knowledge and skills to lead a healthy life. Students with sporting talent are progressively developed through exposure to competitive sports within and beyond the school. The school has a proud sporting tradition, especially in Hockey and Floorball, with several of its alumni players representing Singapore in international competitions and many others representing sports clubs in local leagues. The King's Pipe Band which consists of Scottish bagpipes and drums performers, is a part of the Boys' Brigade contingent, and has been highly regarded in South East Asia. For an all-round educational experience, the school also offers level camps, Science Research Programme and Internationalisation Programme to Asian countries where students can gain cross-cultural insights.

visionstatement_desc: Every Greenviewan a Passionate Learner, Confident Leader, and Caring Citizen
missionstatement_desc: Engaging Hearts, Enriching Minds, Developing Character
philosophy_culture_ethos: Guided by our philosophy that 'Every Child is Unique and can Learn', we aim to cultivate moral character in our students, and inspire them to discover their strengths and strive for success. Through our school values of respect, responsibility, resourcefulness and resilience, we develop a growth mindset and caring culture in students, emphasizing self-directedness at leading self and others, in pursuit of excellence for the community. Greenview has a strong tradition in enlisting the support of successful alumni whose sense of loyalty and belonging to the school is evident in their involvement in school committees or planning and execution of activities for current students. At the heart of our students' success is our Greenview family of nurturing teachers and supportive parents who have worked together to engage our students in their learning and make things possible for them.
special_sdp_offered: Our Highly Effective Youth programme aims to develop the 7 Habits of Highly Effective Teens in our students, in tandem with the Highly Effective Community Leaders programme which empowers them to render useful service to those in need.  All our students participate in the National Youth Achievement Award programme to develop self-reliance, perseverance and a sense of responsibility to themselves, society and nation.  To support this, the Social-Emotional Learning Festival provides avenues (e.g. creative arts, dragon boating, kayaking, rock-climbing, abseiling, trekking, camps and overseas adventure and community service) for students to further hone their interpersonal skills and our Learn to Play Sports programme encourages participation in physical recreation. Our Design and Engineering programme enables students to integrate scientific innovations with human desirability and economic viability and the STAR programme challenges students to stretch themselves in their areas of strengths (e.g. Maths Olympiad, Innovation Programme, Art Elective, Debates, and Humanities and Sciences explorations).  The T3 programme builds teacher-student relationships through weekly discussions and sharing over tea.

mrt_desc: JURONG EAST MRT, CHINESE GARDEN MRT, LAKESIDE MRT
visionstatement_desc: An organisation of STARS who are Strong in Character, Thinking and Caring, Aspiring for Excellence, and Ready to serve Singapore and beyond
missionstatement_desc: Nurturing World-Ready Youths
philosophy_culture_ethos: We believe in nurturing students to be world-ready youths by providing a student-centric, values-driven education that enhances students' academic, social-emotional, aesthetic and physical development. We offer a balance of curricular and co-curricular programmes to support students' acquisition of competencies and skills relevant to the 21st century. Our dedicated and caring teachers plan and create with the help of our partners, opportunities that allow students to experience and strive for success in every area of their lives. We believe that the holistic education we provide will prepare our students to be ready for work and life in the future.
special_sdp_offered: Through our Applied Learning Programme, 'Real World Learning Through Electronics', we provide opportunities for our students to engage in authentic tasks and to acquire 21st Century Competencies.  Students will learn and understand concepts and issues related to electronics, and work in teams to apply concepts learnt to solve electronic-related tasks.   The infusion of Electronics Education into the curriculum is designed to achieve synergistic learning outcomes for students.  The school's Sports A.Li.V.E! programme seeks to engage all students in sports and physical activities while equipping them with the knowledge, skills and competencies to enjoy and promote a healthy lifestyle. Students who show keen interest and talent in sports are further developed through its sports leadership and talent development programmes.  The Whole School Approach to Effective Communication (WSA-EC) aims to nurture World-Ready Youths who are life-long readers, critical thinkers and confident communicators through exposure, experience and reflection. Students can look forward to a vibrant learning environment filled with novels, poetry, drama, theme-based reading, oral presentations and writing programmes designed to equip them with the competencies to communicate well and excel in a globalised world.

mrt_desc: ANG MO KIO MRT, BISHAN MRT, MARYMOUNT MRT
visionstatement_desc: Resilient Achievers, Responsible Citizens.  Peirceans will rise above challenges to stretch their potential.  They have a sense of belonging to school and nation; and seek to serve others.
missionstatement_desc: Our Mission is to build a learning community whose hallmark is the Passion to Excel with Integrity, Respect, Care and Empathy.
philosophy_culture_ethos: Our School Motto "Fax Mentis Incendium Gloriae" signifies that the school is the spark that ignites the minds of our students and encourages them to strive for excellence and the good of their community. Our students are Disciplined Learners with a strong sense of purpose & ownership of their learning; Adaptable Leaders with the ability to persevere to rise above challenges; Enterprising Thinkers with the ability to innovate and exercise initiative; Global Citizens with good knowledge of local and world affairs. Our teachers are committed to nurturing the whole child. We strive to develop in our students the school values of Passion to Excel, Integrity, Respect and Care & Empathy for others. Our parents and community are our key partners in forging strong collaboration and partnerships to enable the school to achieve our Vision of developing our students to be resilient achievers and responsible citizens.
special_sdp_offered: The school offers the Applied Learning Programme (ALP) and Learning for Life Programme (LLP) with the aim of nurturing students to be entrepreneurs and community leaders with the heart to serve. This is in alignment with the school vision of developing 'Resilient Achievers and Responsible Citizens'. The ALP focusses on equipping students with essential skills and knowledge of business and entrepreneurship including ICT and Design Thinking tools and marketing and presentation skills through level wide programmes such as Elective Modules, Advance Elective Modules and Values in Action. The LLP aims to develop leadership skills progressively in all students; beginning with personal and community leadership and culminating in executive leadership. All students will acquire basic leadership competencies, social emotional skills and values to become community leaders.  The programme utilises carefully selected tools including 7 Habits of Effective Teens, National Youth Achievement Award, experiential outdoor learning and leadership profiling tools.  It will also leverage the current strength of the school in Uniformed Groups (UGs) to provide UG experiences for non-UG students.  In all, the school is committed to nurturing learners with skills and values to innovate and gracious citizens with the heart to serve.

mrt_desc: JURONG EAST MRT, CHINESE GARDEN MRT
visionstatement_desc: Everyone Empowered and Enlightened
missionstatement_desc: To nurture our students to be dynamic learners, gracious and concerned citizens, empowered to lead and serve.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We are guided by our philosophy 'Everyone can Learn, Everyone can Achieve and Everyone can Contribute' in our efforts to nurture our students to be empowered and enlightened. We offer a student-centric, values-driven education that helps our students to enjoy their school experience as well as to pursue their passion and interests for life-long learning. Over the years, our students have done well in both the academic and non-academic domains. Our school community strongly believes in the school motto 'Beyond Self' in leading the school towards achieving our vision. Our students' success is due to the hard work of a nurturing team of dedicated teachers, supportive parents, alumni and community.
special_sdp_offered: The school's two distinctive programmes are its "Sports for Life" and "In Health We Thrive" programmes.  "Sports for Life" is the school's Learning for Life programme.  It exposes students to a variety of sports electives, empowers them to be leaders and enables those with talent to excel in a particular sport. The programme builds on the school's active sporting culture to allow all students to learn a wide range of sports and games, so that they develop positive attitudes towards a healthy lifestyle and are ready for active sports participation even beyond schooling years.  Through the programme, students also learn to organise sports events and acquire useful skills, both in sports and in more generic domains.  The school has also formed networks with many sporting associations and clubs to provide opportunities for students who demonstrate talent in these areas to train with these clubs. Values and life skills are taught explicitly through the school's "Sports for Life". This unique character development approach in complemented by a strong service learning and empowerment orientation of the school, where programmes like Values-in-Action (local & overseas), Level Camps, and the JVS Leadership Development Programme serve as authentic platforms for character building in all its students. "In Health We Thrive" is the school's Applied Learning Programme in Health and Wellness.  It provides students with authentic learning of food and sports sciences, and helps students connect the science and skills behind health and wellness.

first_vp_name: MRS ROSIE LAU @ MDM ROSIE LIM
visionstatement_desc: A Vibrant Community of Learners who Lead and Contribute to Family, Nation and Beyond.
missionstatement_desc: To Grow a Vibrant Community of Leader-Learners of Character who Contribute to Family, Nation and Beyond.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We strive to develop all our students to be learning leaders firmly anchored in sound moral values through a student-centric, values-driven education within a holistic learning environment.  These values are infused into the academic curriculum, the Applied Learning Programme (ALP), the Learning for Life Programme (LLP) and the Character and Citizenship Education (CCE) curriculum. We develop character by building strong teacher-student relationships and trust. Our team of committed staff focus on nurturing students to give of their best to realize their dreams with courage, to succeed in life and contribute to the school, nation and beyond.
special_sdp_offered: The school is committed to equipping our students with the necessary 21st century competencies for the future via our CCE curriculum, Values In Action programmes including Service Learning, a vibrant CCA programme, Creative Arts Programme, Leadership opportunities, Applied Learning (ALP) and Learning for Life (LLP) Programmes. In partnership with the Singapore Science Centre and the Curriculum Planning and Development Division of MOE, our ALP on 'Sustainability' seeks to enable our students to attain the relevant knowledge, 21st century competencies, in particular, Applied Critical and Inventive Thinking Skills (ACIT), values and attitudes to enable them to be effective workers and persons who positively contribute to a sustainable 21st century world. Our ALP makes relevant the knowledge in our classrooms to our students' daily life experiences via authentic learning tasks, and enables our students to learn the process skills of design thinking, problem-based learning, and inquiry-based learning. The school is committed to bringing out the leadership potential in every student through our Student Leadership Programme (our LLP). This programme aims to build in our students the necessary 21st century skills, core values, and social and emotional competencies to face the challenges of the future. Our 'Educate-Encourage-Empower' framework and whole-staff involvement ensure an integrated and systematic student leadership development effort. Every student is 'educated' with an enhanced awareness of leading self and others, as well as relevant life-skills, and student leaders are given additional training to perform their roles and responsibilities well. Recognition structures are in place to 'encourage' personal mastery and development of leadership skills. Our students are also 'empowered' to undertake self- as well as class-initiated projects, to organise student-led programmes, and to give feedback and suggestions and take follow-up action for school improvement.

visionstatement_desc: Confident learners with the passion to excel . Active citizens with a heart to serve
missionstatement_desc: Serving with heart, values and purpose to bring out the best in every child
philosophy_culture_ethos: Guided by the school philosophy - teaching with passion and conviction, every child can learn, developing each child holistically, and preparing students for future challenges, Kranji Secondary builds a shared vision that is values-driven and student-centric. The school believes that, through fostering a culture of learning, innovation and excellence, students will be confident learners with the passion to excel and active citizens with a heart to serve.
special_sdp_offered: In Kranji Secondary School, we see innovation as a way of life to support our vision of developing 'Confident Learners with the Passion to Excel'. Our belief in delivering a holistic education has led the school to develop a well-rounded secondary school curriculum. This includes a vibrant Aesthetics Development Programme, comprehensive Sports Development and CCE Programmes to develop Kranjians with character and graciousness. All lower secondary students are exposed to a range of music skills and dances so that they develop an appreciation for the arts and culture. To inculcate a spirit of active citizenry, the school initiates and collaborates extensively with external partners in Values-In-Action projects. The school has two distinctive programmes. Through our Applied Learning Programme (ALP), Thinking Curriculum, Kranji Secondary nurtures communities of reflective and independent learners.  The learning of Thinking Routines through the Thinking Curriculum, allows students to learn tools to make their thinking visible, thus enriching and enhancing their learning. With the Thinking Routines integrated into the various curricular and non-curricular subjects, students develop dispositions to think both critically and inventively, and analyse situations from different perspectives, increasing the level of engagement in their learning. Students also have the opportunity to apply these routines in an authentic learning environment through collaboration with the polytechnics. Secondly, the school has been accorded the Learning for Life Programme (LLP) in Student Leadership. The objective of the programme is to develop A Leader in Every Kranjian. The vision for student leadership in the school is closely linked to the school vision - 'Confident Learners with the Passion to Excel, Active Citizens with a Heart to Serve'. The school adopts the Kouzes and Posner Leadership Challenge Model to create platforms to help fulfil the leadership potential of every student.

mrt_desc: BOON LAY MRT, PIONEER MRT, JOO KOON MRT
visionstatement_desc: A Gracious Community of Life-long Learners with Strength of Character
missionstatement_desc: Inspiring Learning . Inculcating Values . Impacting Lives . To prepare JYians to be future-ready and useful citizens by inculcating values and inspiring in them a passion for learning.
philosophy_culture_ethos: We are guided by our school philosophy, OYSTER, in achieving our vision. We are a nurturing family for students of all abilities and backgrounds, as we believe that every student is unique and every student can learn. We aspire to enhance and amplify the individual talents of all students, and develop them to be persons with strength of character, such that they may, like pearls, shine and illuminate any organisation that they may join in the future. Underpinning our philosophy are our school values, R3IGHT (Respect, Resilience, Responsibility, Integrity, Graciousness, Humility and Teamwork). Our culture of care and learning is achieved through our H.E.A.R.T.S. ethos - setting High expectations and standards; placing strong Emphasis on learning; having the Autonomy to innovate and explore; building quality Relationships; Trust and Teamwork; having a Shared purpose. Through our holistic approach in developing our students, our students have achieved value-added results in the national examinations as well as outstanding outcomes in their co-curricular activities.
special_sdp_offered: Applied Learning Programme (ALP): The school's ALP aims to develop students to be competent and confident communicators. Students undergo a series of oracy programmes from Sec 1 to Sec 3 such as storytelling (Sec 1), drama (Sec 2) and debate (Sec 3).
